TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi abstract sealed beforefieldinit RuntimeHelpers extends System.Object
public ref class RuntimeHelpers abstract sealed

summary.span: 提供一组为编译器提供支持的静态方法和属性。

span.span: Provides a set of static methods and properties that provide support for compilers.

summary.span: 此类不能被继承。

span.span: This class cannot be inherited.

remarks.format: ## Examples 下面的示例演示如何使用可靠地设置句柄方法。The following example shows how to reliably set handles by using the method. 若要可靠地将句柄设置为指定预先存在的句柄，您必须确保本机句柄的分配，并且在该句柄的后续记录对象是原子。To reliably set a handle to a specified pre-existing handle, you must ensure that the allocation of the native handle and the subsequent recording of that handle within a object is atomic. 这些操作 （如线程中止或内存不足异常） 之间的任何失败会导致泄漏的本机句柄。Any failure between these operations (such as a thread abort or out-of-memory exception) will result in the native handle being leaked. 可以使用方法以确保句柄不会泄露。You can use the method to make sure that the handle is not leaked. [!code-csharp[SafeHandle-RuntimeHelpers.PrepareConstrainedRegions#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR/SafeHandle-RuntimeHelpers.PrepareConstrainedRegions/cs/sample.cs#1)] [!code-vb[SafeHandle-RuntimeHelpers.PrepareConstrainedRegions#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR/SafeHandle-RuntimeHelpers.PrepareConstrainedRegions/vb/sample.vb#1)]

MemberSignature.Value: .method public static hidebysig void EnsureSufficientExecutionStack() cil managed

summary.span: 确保剩余的堆栈控件足够大，可以执行一般的 .NET Framework 函数。

span.span: Ensures that the remaining stack space is large enough to execute the average .NET Framework function.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 提供了有关保留足够的空间会引发异常的人为限制堆栈的信息和要采取的恢复操作。 provides information about an artificially limited stack that preserves enough space for an exception to be raised and recovery action to be taken. 公共语言运行时选择了人工堆栈限制以确保足够的空间保持安全地引发异常。The artificial stack limit is chosen by the common language runtime to ensure that enough space remains to throw an exception safely. 此方法是在堆栈溢出可能会导致无限递归的情况下很有用。This method is useful in situations where stack overflow might occur as a result of unbounded recursion. 尽管它还可安全地在其他开发方案，它被适用于在编译器服务方案中使用。It is intended for use in compiler services scenarios, although it can also be used safely in other development scenarios. 如果堆栈空间是否充足，不会引发异常，并且仍可以调用大多数.NET Framework 类型和成员。If the stack space is sufficient, the exception is not thrown, and most .NET Framework types and members can still be called. > [!NOTE] > 此方法不是受约束的执行区域 (CER) 支持的一部分，不应与混淆方法。This method is not part of the constrained execution region (CER) support, and should not be confused with the method.

exception.span: 可用堆栈空间不足，无法执行一般的 .NET Framework 函数。

span.span: The available stack space is insufficient to execute the average .NET Framework function.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public static hidebysig int32 GetHashCode(object o) cil managed
Public Shared Function GetHashCode (o As Object) As Integer

param.name: o
param.span: 要检索其哈希代码的对象。

span.span: An object to retrieve the hash code for.

summary.span: 用作特定对象的哈希函数，适合在使用哈希代码的算法和数据结构（如哈希表）中使用。

span.span: Serves as a hash function for a particular object, and is suitable for use in algorithms and data structures that use hash codes, such as a hash table.

returns.span: 参数标识的对象的哈希代码。

span.span: A hash code for the object identified by the parameter.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 方法将始终调用方法非虚拟，即使该对象的类型重写方法。The method always calls the method non-virtually, even if the object's type has overridden the method. 因此，使用可能不同于调用`GetHashCode`对象上直接方法。Therefore, using might differ from calling `GetHashCode` directly on the object with the method. > [!WARNING] > 尽管方法返回的相同对象引用相同的哈希代码，您应使用此方法测试对象标识，因为此哈希代码不唯一标识的对象引用。Although the method returns identical hash codes for identical object references, you should not use this method to test for object identity, because this hash code does not uniquely identify an object reference. 若要对其进行对象标识测试 （也就是说，若要测试两个对象引用同一对象在内存中），调用方法。To test for object identify (that is, to test that two objects reference the same object in memory), call the method. 也不应使用来测试是否两个字符串表示相等的对象引用，因为字符串暂留。Nor should you use to test whether two strings represent equal object references, because the string is interned. 若要测试是否字符串暂留，请调用方法。To test for string interning, call the method. 和方法的行为有所不同，如下所示：The and methods differ as follows: - 返回基于对象的定义的相等性的哈希代码。 returns a hash code that is based on the object's definition of equality. 例如，具有相同内容的两个字符串将返回相同的值为。For example, two strings with identical contents will return the same value for . - 返回指示对象标识的哈希代码。 returns a hash code that indicates object identity. 也就是说，两个字符串的变量的内容相同，并且表示暂存的字符串 (请参阅[字符串暂留](#interning)部分) 或内存中的单个字符串返回相同的表示哈希代码。That is, two string variables whose contents are identical and that represent a string that is interned (see the [String Interning](#interning) section) or that represent a single string in memory return identical hash codes. > [!IMPORTANT] > 请注意，始终返回相等的对象引用的完全相同的哈希代码。Note that always returns identical hash codes for equal object references. 但是，反过来则不适用： 相等哈希代码并不表示相等的对象引用。However, the reverse is not true: equal hash codes do not indicate equal object references. 特定哈希代码值不是唯一的特定对象引用;不同的对象的引用可以生成相同的哈希代码。A particular hash code value is not unique to a particular object reference; different object references can generate identical hash codes. 由编译器使用此方法。This method is used by compilers. ## 字符串暂留String Interning 公共语言运行时 (CLR) 维护字符串的内部池，并将文本存储在池中。The common language runtime (CLR) maintains an internal pool of strings and stores literals in the pool. 如果两个字符串 (例如，`str1`和`str2`) 相同的字符串文字，CLR 将设置从形成`str1`和`str2`使其指向托管堆，以节省内存上的同一位置。If two strings (for example, `str1` and `str2`) are formed from an identical string literal, the CLR will set `str1` and `str2` to point to the same location on the managed heap to conserve memory. 调用上这两个字符串对象将生成相同的哈希代码，与上一节中的第二个项目符号项相反。Calling on these two string objects will produce the same hash code, contrary to the second bulleted item in the previous section. CLR 将仅文本添加到池。The CLR adds only literals to the pool. 除非编译器解析为单个字符串文本字符串串联，比如串联的字符串操作的结果不会添加到池。Results of string operations such as concatenation are not added to the pool, unless the compiler resolves the string concatenation as a single string literal. 因此，如果`str2`串联运算，因此创建并`str2`等同于`str1`，并使用上这两个字符串对象不会生成相同的哈希代码。Therefore, if `str2` was created as the result of a concatenation operation, and `str2` is identical to `str1`, using on these two string objects will not produce the same hash code. 如果你想要显式添加到池的串联的字符串，使用方法。If you want to add a concatenated string to the pool explicitly, use the method. 此外可以使用方法来检查字符串是否具有暂留的引用。You can also use the method to check whether a string has an interned reference. ## Examples 下面的示例演示之间的差异和方法。The following example demonstrates the difference between the and methods. 该示例的输出说明了以下信息：The output from the example illustrates the following: - 这两个集的第一组字符串的哈希代码传递给`ShowHashCodes`方法是不同的因为字符串是完全不同。Both sets of hash codes for the first set of strings passed to the `ShowHashCodes` method are different, because the strings are completely different. - 生成相同的哈希代码的第二个集的字符串传递给`ShowHashCodes`方法，因为字符串是否相等。 generates the same hash code for the second set of strings passed to the `ShowHashCodes` method, because the strings are equal. 但是，方法却没有。However, the method does not. 第一个字符串由使用字符串文字定义，因此暂留。The first string is defined by using a string literal and so is interned. 虽然第二个字符串的值相同，但它未被暂存，因为它将返回通过调用方法。Although the value of the second string is the same, it is not interned, because it is returned by a call to the method. - 在第三个字符串的情况下生成的哈希代码一样为两个字符串是相同的是由生成的哈希代码。In the case of the third string, the hash codes produced by for both strings are identical, as are the hash codes produced by . 这是因为编译器已被处理为单个字符串文本，分配给两个字符串的值，因此这些字符串变量引用同一留用的字符串。This is because the compiler has treated the value assigned to both strings as a single string literal, and so the string variables refer to the same interned string. [!code-csharp[System.Runtime.CompilerServices.RuntimeHelpers.GetHashCode#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.runtime.compilerservices.runtimehelpers.gethashcode/cs/gethashcodeex1.cs#1)] [!code-vb[System.Runtime.CompilerServices.RuntimeHelpers.GetHashCode#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.runtime.compilerservices.runtimehelpers.gethashcode/vb/gethashcodeex1.vb#1)]

MemberSignature.Value: .method public static hidebysig object GetObjectValue(object obj) cil managed
Public Shared Function GetObjectValue (obj As Object) As Object

span.span: The value type to be boxed.

summary.span: 将值类型装箱。

span.span: Boxes a value type.

returns.span: 如果 是一个值类，则返回其装箱的副本；否则返回 本身。

span.span: A boxed copy of if it is a value class; otherwise, itself.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 装箱值类型创建一个对象，并执行浅表复制到新的对象指定的值类型的字段。Boxing a value type creates an object and performs a shallow copy of the fields of the specified value type into the new object. 此方法允许值类要操作作为一个对象时它将保留值类的别名行为。This method allows a value class to be manipulated as an object while it retains the aliasing behavior of a value class. 返回值取决于值类是可变或不可变：The return value depends on whether the value class is mutable or immutable: - 如果所赋的值是可变的值类，该方法将返回类的浅表副本，因为值类具有复制语义。If the value being assigned is a mutable value class, the method returns a shallow copy of the class, because value classes have copy semantics. - 如果所赋的值是一个不可变值类，该方法将返回对象本身，而不是类的副本。If the value being assigned is an immutable value class, the method returns the object itself, instead of a copy of the class. 动态类型化语言编译器可以使用此方法以确保，装箱的值类型的工作方式与对未装箱的值类型。Compilers of dynamically typed languages can use this method to make sure that boxed value types work identically to unboxed value types. 也就是说，传递它们，并始终按值传递时，获取克隆装箱的值类型。That is, boxed value types get cloned when you pass them around, and they are always passed by value. 编译器可以调用要分配给对象的值类型，也可作为类型对象的参数传递值类型。The compiler can call to assign a value type to an object or to pass a value type as a parameter of a type object. 由编译器使用此方法。This method is used by compilers. ## Examples 下面的示例演示如何通过使用框值类方法。The following example demonstrates how to box a value class by using the method. [!code-csharp[Runtime.CompilerServices.RuntimeHelpers.GetObjectValue#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR/Runtime.CompilerServices.RuntimeHelpers.GetObjectValue/cs/example.cs#1)] [!code-vb[Runtime.CompilerServices.RuntimeHelpers.GetObjectValue#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR/Runtime.CompilerServices.RuntimeHelpers.GetObjectValue/vb/example.vb#1)]

Attribute.AttributeName: get: System.Runtime.TargetedPatchingOptOut("Performance critical to inline across NGen image boundaries")

summary.span: 获取给定字符串中数据的偏移量（以字节为单位）。

span.span: Gets the offset, in bytes, to the data in the given string.

value.span: 字节偏移量，从 对象的起始位置到字符串中的第一个字符。

span.span: The byte offset, from the start of the object to the first character in the string.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 编译器使用此属性的不安全，但高效的指针操作的托管字符串中的字符。Compilers use this property for unsafe, but efficient, pointer operations on the characters in a managed string. 编译器应锁定之前使用垃圾回收器移动的字符串。Compilers should pin the string against movement by the garbage collector before use. 请注意，公共语言运行时字符串是不可变;也就是说，可以读取但不是会更改其内容。Note that common language runtime strings are immutable; that is, their contents can be read but not changed.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public static hidebysig void PrepareConstrainedRegions() cil managed

summary.span: 将代码体指定为受约束的执行区域 (CER)。

span.span: Designates a body of code as a constrained execution region (CER).

remarks.format: ## Remarks 编译器使用此方法将标记`catch`， `finally`，和`fault`块为受约束的执行区域 (Cer)。Compilers use this method to mark `catch`, `finally`, and `fault` blocks as constrained execution regions (CERs). 标记为受约束的区域必须只调用其他具有强可靠性协定代码的代码。Code that is marked as a constrained region must only call other code with strong reliability contracts. 它不应分配或进行虚拟调用未准备好或不可靠的方法，除非它已准备好处理失败。It should not allocate or make virtual calls to unprepared or unreliable methods unless it is prepared to handle failures. 请注意，除其他任何中间语言操作码`NOP`，允许对的调用之间方法和`try`块。Note that no intermediate language opcodes, except `NOP`, are allowed between a call to the method and the `try` block. 有关 Cer 的详细信息，请参阅中的类命名空间。For more information about CERs, see the classes in the namespace. 使用标记的 Cer方法不起作用完全时生成从`try`块。CERs that are marked using the method do not work perfectly when a is generated from the `try` block. 有关更多信息，请参见 方法。For more information, see the method. 方法调用 方法。The method calls the method. ## Examples 下面的示例演示如何使用可靠地设置句柄方法。The following example shows how to reliably set handles by using the method. 若要可靠地将句柄设置为指定预先存在的句柄，您必须确保本机句柄的分配，并且在该句柄的后续记录对象是原子。To reliably set a handle to a specified pre-existing handle, you must ensure that the allocation of the native handle and the subsequent recording of that handle within a object is atomic. 这些操作 （如线程中止或内存不足异常） 之间的任何失败会导致泄漏的本机句柄。Any failure between these operations (such as a thread abort or out-of-memory exception) will result in the native handle being leaked. 可以使用方法以确保句柄不会泄露。You can use the method to make sure that the handle is not leaked. [!code-csharp[SafeHandle-RuntimeHelpers.PrepareConstrainedRegions#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR/SafeHandle-RuntimeHelpers.PrepareConstrainedRegions/cs/sample.cs#1)] [!code-vb[SafeHandle-RuntimeHelpers.PrepareConstrainedRegions#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR/SafeHandle-RuntimeHelpers.PrepareConstrainedRegions/vb/sample.vb#1)]

span.span: requires full trust for the immediate caller.

permission.span: 不能由部分受信任的或透明的代码使用此成员。

Attribute.AttributeName: System.Runtime.TargetedPatchingOptOut("Performance critical to inline across NGen image boundaries")

summary.span: 将代码体指定为受约束的执行区域 (CER)，无需执行任何探测。

span.span: Designates a body of code as a constrained execution region (CER) without performing any probing.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 编译器不应直接调用此方法。Compilers should not call this method directly. 相反，通过调用定义 CER方法。Instead, define a CER by calling the method.

permission.span: 直接调用方需要完全信任。

span.span: requires full trust for the immediate caller.

permission.span: 不能由部分受信任的或透明的代码使用此成员。

MemberSignature.Value: .method public static hidebysig void PrepareContractedDelegate(class System.Delegate d) cil managed
Public Shared Sub PrepareContractedDelegate (d As Delegate)

span.span: The event delegate to prepare.

summary.span: 提供应用程序用来动态准备 事件委托的方法。

span.span: Provides a way for applications to dynamically prepare event delegates.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 事件委托如， ，和不在启动时自动准备。 event delegates such as , , and are not automatically prepared at startup. 可以使用以下方法以使其准备好：You can use the following methods to prepare them: - 通过使用属性方法属性。Attribute the method by using the attribute. - 通过使用属性方法属性。Attribute the method by using the attribute. - 调用方法来动态准备该委托。Call the method to dynamically prepare the delegate. 有关详细信息，请参阅文章[保持您的代码运行的.NET Framework 的可靠性功能](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=145491)MSDN 杂志中。For more information, see the article [Keep Your Code Running with the Reliability Features of the .NET Framework](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=145491) in the MSDN Magazine.

permission.span: 直接调用方需要完全信任。

span.span: requires full trust for the immediate caller.

permission.span: 不能由部分受信任的或透明的代码使用此成员。

span.span: This member cannot be used by partially trusted or transparent code.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public static hidebysig void PrepareDelegate(class System.Delegate d) cil managed
Public Shared Sub PrepareDelegate (d As Delegate)

span.span: The delegate type to prepare.

summary.span: 指示应准备指定委托以包含在受约束的执行区域 (CER) 中。

span.span: Indicates that the specified delegate should be prepared for inclusion in a constrained execution region (CER).

remarks.format: ## Remarks 编译器使用整个此方法来准备委托的调用方法并准备该调用 （和委托的静态确定的调用关系图） 的目标，为受约束的执行区域 (CER)。Compilers use this method to prepare a delegate's invocation method and to prepare the target of that invocation (and the delegate's statically determinable call graph) as a constrained execution region (CER).

permission.span: 直接调用方需要完全信任。

span.span: requires full trust for the immediate caller.

permission.span: 不能由部分受信任的或透明的代码使用此成员。

span.span: This member cannot be used by partially trusted or transparent code.

summary.span: 准备一个要包含在受约束的执行区域 (CER) 中的方法。

span.span: Prepares a method for inclusion in a constrained execution region (CER).

MemberSignature.Value: .method public static hidebysig void PrepareMethod(valuetype System.RuntimeMethodHandle method) cil managed
Public Shared Sub PrepareMethod (method As RuntimeMethodHandle)

span.span: A handle to the method to prepare.

summary.span: 准备一个要包含在受约束的执行区域 (CER) 中的方法。

span.span: Prepares a method for inclusion in a constrained execution region (CER).

remarks.format: ## Remarks 编译器使用方法以处理都是在受约束的执行区域 (CER) 内的虚拟调用。Compilers use the method to handle virtual calls that are made inside a constrained execution region (CER). 在 JIT 编译时，公共语言运行时通常没有足够的有关虚拟调用的目标信息。At JIT compilation time, the common language runtime does not usually have enough information about the target of a virtual call. 因此，在运行时最初不准备的调用关系图的该部分。Therefore, the runtime does not initially prepare that segment of the call graph. 如果使用 CER 的代码具有足够的知识以确定在 CER 之前的时间中的任何时候目标实际输入，则它可以调用执行相同的运行时准备通常针对 CER 的根节点指定为参数的方法的执行。If the code that is using the CER has enough knowledge to determine the target at any point in time before the CER is actually entered, it can call to perform the same runtime preparation normally done for a CER rooted at the method specified as an argument.

permission.span: 直接调用方需要完全信任。

span.span: requires full trust for the immediate caller.

permission.span: 不能由部分受信任的或透明的代码使用此成员。

span.span: This member cannot be used by partially trusted or transparent code.

MemberSignature.Value: public static void PrepareMethod (RuntimeMethodHandle method, RuntimeTypeHandle[] instantiation);
.method public static hidebysig void PrepareMethod(valuetype System.RuntimeMethodHandle method, valuetype System.RuntimeTypeHandle[] instantiation) cil managed
Public Shared Sub PrepareMethod (method As RuntimeMethodHandle, instantiation As RuntimeTypeHandle())
public: static void PrepareMethod(RuntimeMethodHandle method, cli::array <RuntimeTypeHandle> ^ instantiation);
static member PrepareMethod : RuntimeMethodHandle * RuntimeTypeHandle[] -> unit

span.span: A handle to the method to prepare.

param.name: instantiation
param.span: 要传递给该方法的实例化。

span.span: The instantiation to pass to the method.

summary.span: 准备一个要包含在受约束的执行区域 (CER) 中的具有指定实例化的方法。

span.span: Prepares a method for inclusion in a constrained execution region (CER) with the specified instantiation.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 您可以通过使用为编译器支持泛型方法。You can provide generics support for compilers by using the method. 公共语言运行时无法准备具有泛型类型参数 （任一类型参数上包含的方法或一个在该方法本身的类） 的方法中取得 root 权限的受约束的执行区域 (Cer) 当实例化这些类型参数作为引用类型。The common language runtime cannot prepare constrained execution regions (CERs) rooted in a method that has generic type parameters (either a type parameter on the class containing the method or one on the method itself) when those type parameters are instantiated as reference types. 可以使用此重载将传递的特定实例化 （如类型的数组），首先指定类类型参数 （如果有） 后, 跟方法类型参数 （如果有）。You can use this overload to pass a specific instantiation (such as an array of types), specifying class type parameters first (if any), followed by method type parameters (if any). 在运行时准备的方法实例化。The runtime prepares that instantiation of the method. （这只有在您使用的实例化包含至少一个引用类型参数。）因此，可以使用 CER 样式`try`泛型方法 （或上一个泛型类的非泛型方法） 中的子句，它将使用的实例化的可靠地工作或其他值类型。(This is necessary only if the instantiations you use contain at least one reference type parameter.) Thus, you can use a CER-style `try` clause in a generic method (or a nongeneric method on a generic class) and it will work reliably with instantiations of or other value types. 若要实例化引用类型，如，则必须使用显式CER 方法首先根方法。To instantiate reference types such as , you must use an explicit method on the CER root method first.

permission.span: 直接调用方需要完全信任。

span.span: requires full trust for the immediate caller.

permission.span: 不能由部分受信任的或透明的代码使用此成员。

span.span: This member cannot be used by partially trusted or transparent code.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public static hidebysig void ProbeForSufficientStack() cil managed

summary.span: 探测某个数量的堆栈空间，以确保不会在后续的代码块内发生堆栈溢出（假设用户的代码仅使用有限适中的堆栈空间）。

span.span: Probes for a certain amount of stack space to ensure that a stack overflow cannot happen within a subsequent block of code (assuming that your code uses only a finite and moderate amount of stack space).

summary.span: 建议使用受约束的执行区域 (CER)，而不使用此方法。

span.span: We recommend that you use a constrained execution region (CER) instead of this method.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 在用户应对堆栈溢出，如 Microsoft SQL Server 和 Microsoft Exchange Server 的主机中运行时，受约束的执行区域 (CER) 基础结构使用此方法。This method is used by the constrained execution region (CER) infrastructure when running in hosts that are resilient to stack overflow such as Microsoft SQL Server and Microsoft Exchange Server. 此方法当前探测程序 48 KB 的堆栈空间在 x86 平台，但具体数量可能随着时间的推移发生变化，在其他平台上可能会有所不同。This method currently probes for 48 KB of stack space on the x86 platform, but the exact amount may change over time and may vary on other platforms. 编译器还使用此方法。This method is also used by compilers. 而不是使用方法，应使用标准 CER。Instead of using the method, you should use a standard CER. 也就是说，如果想要使用中等数量的堆栈空间，则调用方法之前你`try` / `finally`或`try` / `catch`块。That is, if you are planning to use a moderate amount of stack space, call the method immediately before your `try`/`finally` or `try`/`catch` block. 如果正在调用的递归方法或计划使用大量的堆栈空间，则必须使用方法。If you are calling a recursive method or plan to use a lot of stack space, you must use the method.

permission.span: 直接调用方需要完全信任。

span.span: requires full trust for the immediate caller.

permission.span: 不能由部分受信任的或透明的代码使用此成员。

span.span: This member cannot be used by partially trusted or transparent code.
